intro: Poa tetrantha, commonly known as the four-stemmed bluegrass, is a perennial grass native to North America. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and fine, bluish-green leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
